images.copyright: Vineyards in the Mosel Valley, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany (© Jorg Greuel/Getty Images)
images.title: 'Riesling' to perfection
images.caption: Vineyards in the Mosel Valley, Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany
images.desc: Welcome to the Palatinate, a wine lover's dream come true. This wine-growing region in western Germany has rolling hills, fertile soils, and a warm climate, allowing the cultivation of a diverse variety of grapes. While riesling reigns supreme, other notable varieties include chardonnay, sauvignon blanc, pinot blanc, Müller-Thurgau, and Dornfelder. The Palatinate is the largest red wine-producing region in the country, with over 40% of the vineyards devoted to it.
